description: Students explore the topic of family and gender roles in Spanish society by analyzing cultural documents (literary and non-literary texts, including at least one substantive literary work). This cultural analysis provides for the development of critical reading and writing skills (e.g., description, narration, exposition, and argumentation). Taught in Spanish. Offered each semester. Also counts toward gender and sexuality studies and Latin American studies majors and family studies and gender and sexuality studies concentrations. Prerequisite: SPAN 232 or placement into SPAN 250 or SPAN 251.
name: Family/Gender Roles in Spain
notes: Prerequisite: Completion of Spanish placement test or SPAN 232.
Students may take either Spanish 250 or Spanish 251, which are equivalent, but
prerequisites: SPAN 232 or placement into SPAN 250 or SPAN 251.
title: Family and Gender Roles in Spain: 1900 to Present
